description: From translingual Dios(corea) + genin, after German Diosgenin.

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) A steroid sapogenin, obtained from certain yams, that has estrogenic activity.
examples: Obtaining adequate quantities of hormonal substances for research was impossible, however, until the early 1940s, when Russell E. Marker (1902–95) found that he could extract diosgenin from a wild yam growing in Mexico  […]
